intro: Quinchamalium purpureum, commonly known as the purple quinchamalium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its striking purple flowers and woody stems, which are often used in traditional medicine. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, while its flowers are clustered in small inflorescences. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
